This is bad, and should never happen.  I've seen it once or twice in a test
workspace when Eclipse 3.2M1 times out on loading classes.  Does it happen on
every startup?  Could you send me the whole set of exceptions, or at least the
inital 3 after startup?  Those are the ones that have clues about the cause of
the failure (typically a startup synchronization issue).

It happening randomly and probably more often when workbench is restarted by
update manager (I believe I've just installed most recent AJDT build).

Thanks.  I'm about to redo the startup of the user study plug-in as I de-couple
it for the 0.4 release, and should be able to guard against this issue in the
process.

Created an attachment (id=27345)
Complete startup log

It is now happening on every start and Eclipse just won't start when this
happens. So, I had to uninstall Mylar.

Mik, if you have fix for this issue can you please consider an early patch
release trough update manager?

Damn!  I think I just fingured out how to reliably fix this--it has to do with a
wierd timing bug in plug-in loading that causes class circularities.  I will
definitely get an updated build out to you before the end of the day today.  I
guess that the only other thing that you could do now is to re-enable Mylar
0.3.7 in your coinfiguration manager...

I can't get into the update manager in such state. More over I already
uninstalled 0.3.7... Now I feel completely blind without Mylar. :-(

By the way why you don't keep old versions on the update site?

You're right, we should I'll make sure to add them in the next week or two so
that they're the for 0.4 on (when the update site moves to eclipse.org).  

This might sound silly, but you could try to update again now that you've
uninstalled.  I believe that this Eclipse bug is less likely to get triggered if
Mylar is the latest thing in the Eclipse configuration.  Let me know if that
works, and I'll also let you know when the new build is there.

Oh, and if it's possible the way to get the Manager Configuration dialog into
this state is to hit the third toolbar button and get it to show all disabled
plugins..

(In reply to comment #8)
> This might sound silly, but you could try to update again now that you've
> uninstalled.  I believe that this Eclipse bug is less likely to get triggered if
> Mylar is the latest thing in the Eclipse configuration.  Let me know if that
> works, and I'll also let you know when the new build is there.

That was the first thing I've tried and it doesn't help

(In reply to comment #9)
> Oh, and if it's possible the way to get the Manager Configuration dialog into
> this state is to hit the third toolbar button and get it to show all disabled
> plugins..

I know that. But the reason I can't use update manager is because Eclipse is not
responding at all. The whole workbench window is gray.

Damn, ok, I'll make the new build available asap, but it will be minimum 2-3
hours because I'm in a meeting right now.  And the main lesson learned here is
that we *have* to have old versions available.

(In reply to comment #12)
> Damn, ok, I'll make the new build available asap, but it will be minimum 2-3
> hours because I'm in a meeting right now.  And the main lesson learned here is
> that we *have* to have old versions available.

Thanks Mik. Actually there is no real rush for me. I can wait till tomorrow.
After all it is my fault that I've removed previous version. :-)

Eugene, try the following build (0.3.8.2) using the following update site:

  www.cs.ubc.ca/~mylar/test/phase2

Let me know if that resolves the issue.

Created an attachment (id=27375)
Startup log for 0.3.8.2

Still have problems. See attached log.

Thanks for the log.  It's the same problem, and I'm setting everything else
aside until I can solve it.  Sorry for all the trouble, it seems impossible for
me to reproduce, even having installed WTP, which makes it hard to diagnose.

For the record, this probably describes the source of the problem:
http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/platform-core-dev/msg00144.html
I'm investigating how to reduce/refactor what we do during plug-in startup.

I was able to reproduce this bug once by putting my machine under high load and
starting wtp.  I also found the following useful summary of the Eclipse bug that
triggers this: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=5875#c19

To resolve it I made the initialization of all mylar.core and mylar.ui extension
points lazy instead of doing in in the plug-in starts.  I also made the Mylar
core a non-early-startup plug-in, which adds a bunch of laziness too has been
desireable for startup performance reasons.  This still needs more testing, but
I no longer get the startup errors.  Could you let me know if it works for you
by getting 0.3.8.4 using the following update site.  Thanks for your patience in
iterating on this!

  www.cs.ubc.ca/~mylar/test/phase2
Tanks Mik. So far there was no issues. I'll see what happens on next AJDT update...

Great.  The changes I made should make it impossible to get the ClassCircularityError, so I'm marking
this resolved.
